item.title: Senior Analyst, Stress & Impairment
item.description:
Come Work with Us!

At RBC, our culture is deeply supportive and rich in opportunity and reward. You will help our clients thrive and our communities prosper, empowered by a spirit of shared purpose.

Whether you’re helping clients find new opportunities, developing new technology, or providing expert advice to internal partners, you will be doing work that matters in the world, in an environment built on teamwork, service, responsibility, diversity, and integrity.

Job Title

Senior Analyst, Stress & Impairment

Job Description

What is the opportunity?

As part of the Group Risk Management team, the Senior Analyst, Stress & Impairment will support the execution of live production and infrastructure maintenance for our Credit Measurement System (CMS), which employs a collection of models used to estimate and report forward-looking expected credit losses (ECL), primarily for loans in RBC’s banking book portfolios.

What will you do?

  • Assist in the execution and maintenance of time-sensitive IFRS 9 and CECL live production runs in CMS. 
  • Support requests from model builders, validators and auditors regarding data and methodology aspects associated with the credit loss models
  • Develop and/or implement testing and reporting methodologies, including model testing, calibration and monitoring performance
  • Assist in preparation of technical whitepapers and presentations, as well as other documents pertaining to implemented models, technologies, and/or analyses
  • Perform scenario/change impact analyses for communication to Senior Management, with focus on business and risk implications
  • Facilitate integration and automation of modeling and reporting changes in CMS and their promotion to BAU production processes
  • Role focus: analytical and statistical technical tools used for credit risk, data and change management, methodology development & implementation
  • Tailor best solutions based on materiality, timelines and available resources
  • Research and keep abreast on credit methodologies and data analytics, to ensure RBC is a leading institution on best practices across the industry

What do you need to succeed?

Must Have:

  • Undergraduate, and preferably graduate, degree in a quantitative discipline such as physics, mathematics, statistics, engineering, economics, econometrics, actuarial science, finance and/or relevant professional qualifications, with focus on quantitative statistical and analytical skills
  • 1+ years of relevant business work experience in quant groups (risk, front office, etc.) in the financial industry
  • 1+ years of programming experience with tools such as SAS, SQL, Python, Excel/VBA.
  • Ability to communicate complex concepts to a non-technical audience
  • Strong conceptual, analytical, and problem solving skills.  Ability to tailor analysis to required level of precision

Nice-to-Have:

  • FRM and/or CFA would be an asset
  • Prior work experience in credit risk modeling, stress testing, credit portfolio analysis, and credit provisioning would be an asset.

What is in it for you?

We thrive on the challenge to be our best, progressive thinking, to keep growing, and working together to build and deliver trusted reporting to help our stakeholders succeed and communities prosper. We care about each other, reaching our potential, making a difference to our communities, and achieving success that is mutual.

  • A comprehensive Total Rewards Program including bonuses and flexible benefits, competitive compensation
  • Ability to make a difference and lasting impact
  • Work in a dynamic, collaborative, progressive, and high-performing team
  • Opportunities to take on progressively greater accountabilities

Job Summary

The Senior Analyst, Stress & Impairment will support the execution of live production and infrastructure maintenance for our Credit Measurement System (CMS), which employs a collection of models used to estimate and report forward-looking expected credit losses (ECL), primarily for loans in RBC’s banking book portfolios.

You will focus on models for Wholesale, Retail and Capital Markets products, with opportunity to expand and grow through time in other related areas. You will assist Senior Director and Director Stress & Impairment in the execution and maintenance of forward-looking banking-book credit loss projection models and IFRS 9 and CECL credit provisioning and loan portfolio stress testing requirements. You will assist Senior Management and the Board in understanding critical measurement issues relating to forward-looking portfolio performance matters.

The team has significant impact across the bank and continuous interactions with other groups, including Senior Management and regulators.

item.description:
Come Work with Us!

At RBC, our culture is deeply supportive and rich in opportunity and reward. You will help our clients thrive and our communities prosper, empowered by a spirit of shared purpose.

Whether you’re helping clients find new opportunities, developing new technology, or providing expert advice to internal partners, you will be doing work that matters in the world, in an environment built on teamwork, service, responsibility, diversity, and integrity.

Job Title

Claims Reporting Analyst

Job Description

What is the opportunity? 

As a Claims Reporting Analyst, you will provide reporting and analytics support to for the Life and Health Claims Department at RBC Insurance. You will be responsible for ensuring the effectiveness and efficiency of reporting while creating high quality analyses and insights. The role will focus heavily on the timely and accurate delivery of data, information and insight to the end user. If this sounds like you, we want to meet you.

What will you do? 

• Perform deep dive analyses of the Life & Health department data to generate actionable client insights reporting

• Design business analysis utilizing recording systems for use throughout the Life & Health department.

• Accurately analyze and collect data for various types of business reports.

• Create business reports that provide insight into key data points.

• Communicate and provide the results of data analysis in written and verbal form to internal leadership team.

• Collaborate with key partners across the organization to gather data/ insights to advance Life and Health Department targets

Must Have

• 3 to 5 years of insurance or analytics experience

item.title: Senior Data Engineer
item.description:
Come Work with Us!

At RBC, our culture is deeply supportive and rich in opportunity and reward. You will help our clients thrive and our communities prosper, empowered by a spirit of shared purpose.

Whether you’re helping clients find new opportunities, developing new technology, or providing expert advice to internal partners, you will be doing work that matters in the world, in an environment built on teamwork, service, responsibility, diversity, and integrity.

Job Title

Senior Data Engineer

Job Description

What is the opportunity?

RBC (Barbados) Service Company Limited has a vacancy for a Senior Data Engineer.  You will have responsibility for providing business intelligence (leveraging software and services to transform source data into actionable information) at a senior level by using a systematic approach to plan, create, and maintain data architectures while also keeping it aligned with RBC Insurance Company Limited business requirements.

What will you do?

  • Act as the Centre of Expertise in all manner of product-centric data mining activities including reporting, data analysis, aggregation and management while ensuring compliance and privacy guidelines are strictly adhered to
  • Act as strategic partner with Business Partners and help guide them on matters of industry, best business practices, and technology strategies 
  • Develop code, ensure code is reviewed and tested and provide review of coding of junior team members.
  • Seek out new ways to engineer and manufacture best in class standard reports and dashboards to showcase insights and support tactics, including exploration and learning new technologies and systems
  • Responsible for the design, development and management of regular production and ad-hoc data-mining and reporting requests of high to medium complexity (e.g. single source-system requests, writing code).
  • Develop the Extract Transform and Load process and database objects used to load data from source systems into staging tables and transforms data in data mart structures
  • Responsible for constructing and maintaining data architectures and production schedules as senior member of the team
  • Manage the storage of data and access to the data and lead efforts to pinpoint tasks where manual participation can be eliminated with automation

What do you need to succeed?

Must-have

  • Undergraduate degree in Computer Science, or a discipline that develops capability in data mining, analytics and reporting
  • Minimum 5 years’ experience working with financial products/services and corresponding data
  • Solid working experience with very large relational databases and large volumes of data of various formats and MS Office Professional Suite with emphasis on C#, Visual Basic or Visual Basic for Applications
  • Advanced SAS, Apache Spark, MapReduce, Oracle Data, SQL, Python, R, VBA, JCL, SAS, GDG, JTS
  • SQL programming demonstrating the use of efficient querying/datamining techniques
  • Knowledge of statistical procedures and applied data validation mechanisms and knowledge of Dashboard Reporting methodology
  • Solid knowledge of SQL and experience with Tableau, Netezza (IBM) and Hadoop

What’s in it for you?

We thrive on the challenge to be our best, progressive thinking to keep growing, and working together to deliver trusted advice to help our clients thrive and communities prosper. We care about each other, reaching our potential, making a difference to our communities, and achieving success that is mutual.

  • Opportunity to do challenging work and make a difference with lasting impact
  • The advantage of working with a dynamic, collaborative, and high performing team where initiative and hard work are recognized and rewarded
  • Leaders that support your development

Job Summary

Supports the development and maintenance of scalable data stores that supply big data in forms needed for business analysis. Applies experience and seasoned knowledge, skills, and practices to perform a variety of assignments.

item.title: Manager, Strategic Reporting
item.description:
Come Work with Us!

At RBC, our culture is deeply supportive and rich in opportunity and reward. You will help our clients thrive and our communities prosper, empowered by a spirit of shared purpose.

Whether you’re helping clients find new opportunities, developing new technology, or providing expert advice to internal partners, you will be doing work that matters in the world, in an environment built on teamwork, service, responsibility, diversity, and integrity.

Job Title

Manager, Strategic Reporting

Job Description

What is the opportunity?

Responsible for building compelling data solutions and dashboards that provide actionable intelligence and a high level of satisfaction to end users.  The successful candidate is able to manage relatively complex reporting projects independently and act effectively as a consultant with partners and stakeholders.  This is done through the use of various ETL tools, code building, analyzing, data manipulation, presentation layer excellence and process efficiency.  Strong teamwork is a must as the role requires coordination and collaboration with other data partners.

What will you do?

• Design, create, operationalize and maintain innovative, efficient and consolidated self-serve dashboards

• Responsible for data model development, end-to-end data curation, testing and data management of medium to high complexity reporting projects involving multi-source, multi-product and multi-distribution channel content

• Investigate and resolve data and reporting issues

• Work directly with business partners and other data professionals to create reporting using Tableau Desktop

• Proactively and frequently communicates ideas effectively in group settings

• Act as a consultant and subject-matter-expert with partners & stakeholders at all levels driving a superior internal client experience

What will you need to succeed?

• Minimum 3 years’ work experience in a role utilizing the required skills and knowledge

• Proven ETL experience using large volumes of data of various formats in a multi-tasking work environment

• Strong knowledge of Tableau Desktop, MS Excel, SQL (or similar language) and dashboard building methodologies

• Ability to proactively solve & manage complex data / programming / reporting problems / projects independently

• Positive attitude, team player, effective communications and collaboration skills

• Strong internal client satisfaction outlook

• Degree in Computer Science, Statistics, Math, Analytics, or equivalent

What\'s in it for you?

• A Total Rewards program that includes flexible benefits, work/life balance and career development programs and investment and retirement savings plans

• Competitive pay and high-earning potential

• All the tools, training, and team support you need to grow your career

• Flexible work/life balance options

• Sophisticated RBCI software tools to boost your productivity
